definition: to inflate/to pump up/fig. to encourage/to boost morale
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
bicycle pump

sentences.english: The neighbor often borrowed my inflator.
sentences.chinese: 鄰居經常借我家的打氣筒。

sentences.english: Since the football has lost air, we shall need a pump to inflate it.
sentences.chinese: 這個球漏氣了，我們需要一個氣筒打氣。

sentences.english: Somebody else lent me a pump and helped me mend the puncture.
sentences.chinese: 別人借給我一個打氣筒，又幫我補好了輪胎。

sentences.english: We use a pump to blow air into our tires.
sentences.chinese: 我們使用打氣筒把氣打進輪胎。

sentences.english: Often I was urged on by the spectators-at least by some of them.
sentences.chinese: 在比賽時，常常有圍觀者爲我加油打氣。

sentences.english: You can pump up the tyres by hand or with this special machine.
sentences.chinese: 這可以用手或用這個特殊的機器給車胎打氣。

sentences.english: The manager tried to hearten the players.
sentences.chinese: 經理設法爲選手們打氣。

sentences.english: Can you lend me your bicycle pump?
sentences.chinese: 能把你的打氣筒借給我嗎？

sentences.english: My bike is short of gas, do you understand where is the gas station?
sentences.chinese: 我的車快沒油了，你清楚最近的打氣站在什麼地方嗎？

sentences.english: Could you please help me to inflate my Swimming ring?
sentences.chinese: 可以幫我給游泳圈打氣嗎？

sentences.english: He put too much air into the balloon and it burst.
sentences.chinese: 他把氣球打氣打得太多了，它爆了。

sentences.english: I bought a bike with its pump.
sentences.chinese: 我買了一部連打氣筒的自行車。

sentences.english: A tyre expands when you pump air into it.
He(Reagan) sent Secretary of State Shultz to Capitol Hill in an effort to shore up wavering Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 卿舒爾茲到國會山莊去給意志動搖的共和黨議員打氣。

sentences.english: I put too much air into the bicycle tyre and it burst.
sentences.chinese: 我把自行車輪胎打氣打得太足了，所以車胎爆破了。

sentences.english: I'll have these tires blown up.
sentences.chinese: 我要給這些輪胎打打氣。
